titleStmt.title: James L. Cargil to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5886

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To his Excellency Tho E Bramlette

The undersigned your Petitioners would represent to your honor that on the day of August 1864. a warrant issued against him from the office of P H Hopkins a Justice of the peace for Clinton County for a breach of the peace and that he was tried under Said warrant before T. C. Ashinhust a Justice of the peace for said County and fined $15. upon said Judgment execution or capias profine has issued -- and is now in the hands of the sheriff. Your Petitioner would represent that he is nearly destitute of property as most all of the moveable property of this county has been run off or taken from the citizens which renders it hard for them to even pay the Tax due the State & fFederal Governments, you are personally well acquainted with my character. and will Judge of this case accordingly. you know whether or not I have been considered a peaceable quiet citizen, if you think I have I ask you to remit the fine aforesaid & hope I will never trouble you with another such request.

We of the jury Will as in it
before whom he was tried
Thomas C Ashinhust J P C C
John Tuggle
Abraham Blair
James R wright
Raul hert
Abijah Means
Joseph Brown
J M Brannam

Clinton Co J. P.
vs
Jas L. Cargil
$15
Breach Peace
4th Oct/64
